    • Method Detail

      • createBuildableSubsetFromWorkItems

        IBuildableSubset2 createBuildableSubsetFromWorkItems(java.lang.String name,
                                                   IContributorHandle owner,
                                                   com.ibm.team.enterprise.buildablesubset.common.dto.Visibility visibility,
                                                   IBuildDefinitionHandle buildDefinitionHandle,
                                                   IWorkItemHandle[] workItemHandles,
                                                   boolean includeWorkItemChildren,
                                                   boolean includeImpacts,
                                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Create a new buildable subset with the given name and the associated build definition. The subset will be pre-populated with buildable files found in the given work items' change sets.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new subset; must not be null
        owner - The owner of the new subset or null if the new subset should be owned by process area associated with the build definition
        visibility - The visibility of subset either PRIVATE_LITERAL or PUBLIC_LITERAL (null)
        buildDefinitionHandle - The build definition associated with the new subset; must not be null
        workItemHandles - A list of work items where to find the buildable files to be included in the new subset; must not be null
        includeWorkItemChildren - If true, all buildable files found in children work items will be included in the new subset; if false, children work items will not be processed
        includeImpacts - If true, impact analysis will perform to include all impacted files.
        monitor - the progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        The subset that has been saved and its modifiedTimestamp is set to when it was last saved.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong.
        Since:
        5.0

      • createBuildableSubsetFromWorkItems2

        IBuildableSubset2 createBuildableSubsetFromWorkItems2(java.lang.String name,
                                                    IContributorHandle owner,
                                                    com.ibm.team.enterprise.buildablesubset.common.dto.Visibility visibility,
                                                    IBuildDefinitionHandle buildDefinitionHandle,
                                                    IWorkItemHandle[] workItemHandles,
                                                    IWorkItemHandle[] dynamicWorkItems,
                                                    boolean includeWorkItemChildren,
                                                    boolean includeImpacts,
                                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Create a new buildable subset with the given name and the associated build definition. The subset will be pre-populated with buildable files found in the given work items' change sets.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new subset; must not be null
        owner - The owner of the new subset or null if the new subset should be owned by process area associated with the build definition
        visibility - The visibility of subset either PRIVATE_LITERAL or PUBLIC_LITERAL (null)
        buildDefinitionHandle - The build definition associated with the new subset; must not be null
        workItemHandles - A list of work items where to find the buildable files to be included in the new subset; must not be null. These work items will be processed up front. Updates to these work items will not be reflected by the subset.
        dynamicWorkItems - A list of work items where to find the buildable files to be included in the new subset; must not be null. These work items will not be processed until the subset is used in a build. Updates to these work items will be reflected by the subset.
        includeWorkItemChildren - If true, all buildable files found in children work items will be included in the new subset; if false, children work items will not be processed
        includeImpacts - If true, impact analysis will perform to include all impacted files.
        monitor - the progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        The subset that has been saved and its modifiedTimestamp is set to when it was last saved.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong.
        Since:
        6.0

      • createBuildableSubset

        IBuildableSubset2 createBuildableSubset(java.lang.String name,
                                      IContributorHandle owner,
                                      com.ibm.team.enterprise.buildablesubset.common.dto.Visibility visibility,
                                      IBuildDefinitionHandle buildDefinitionHandle,
                                      IBuildableFileDesc2[] buildableFileDescs,
                                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Create a new buildable subset with the given name and the associated build definition. The subset will be pre-populated with the list of buildable file descriptors.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new subset; must not be null
        owner - The owner of the new subset or null if the new subset should be owned by process area associated with the build definition
        visibility - The visibility of subset either PRIVATE_LITERAL or PUBLIC_LITERAL (null)
        buildableFileDescs - A list of buildable files to be included in the subset; must not be null or empty
        monitor - the progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        The subset that has been saved and its modifiedTimestamp is set to when it was last saved.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong.
        Since:
        5.0

      • getBuildableSubset

        IBuildableSubset2 getBuildableSubset(java.lang.String name,
                                   IBuildDefinitionHandle buildDefinitionHandle,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieve a buildable subset with the given name and associated build definition.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of an existing subset; must not be null
        buildDefinitionHandle - The build definition associated with an existing subset; must not be null
        monitor - the progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        The subset that was found with the given name; or null if not found
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong.
        Since:
        5.0

      • getBuildableSubset2

        IBuildableSubset2 getBuildableSubset2(java.lang.String name,
                                    IBuildDefinitionHandle buildDefinitionHandle,
                                    boolean evaluateDynamicCriteria,
                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieve a buildable subset with the given name and associated build definition.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of an existing subset; must not be null
        buildDefinitionHandle - The build definition associated with an existing subset; must not be null
        evaluateDynamicCriteria - Whether dynamic criteria should be evaluated before returning the subset.
        monitor - the progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        The subset that was found with the given name; or null if not found
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong.
        Since:
        6.0

      • deleteBuildableSubset

        java.lang.String deleteBuildableSubset(java.lang.String name,
                                     IBuildDefinitionHandle buildDefinitionHandle,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
        Delete the buildable subset with the given name and associated build definition.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of an existing subset; must not be null
        buildDefinitionHandle - The build definition associated with an existing subset; must not be null
        monitor - the progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        The time stamp when the subset was successful deleted.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong.
        Since:
        5.0

      • exists

        boolean exists(java.lang.String name,
             IBuildDefinitionHandle buildDefinitionHandle,
             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns true if the buildable subset with the given name and associated build definition exists
        Parameters:
        name - The name of an existing subset; must not be null
        buildDefinitionHandle - The build definition associated with an existing subset; must not be null
        monitor - the progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        true if the buildable subset exists; and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong.
        Since:
        5.0

      • modifyBuildableSubset

        java.lang.String modifyBuildableSubset(IBuildableSubset2 subset,
                                     java.lang.String previousName,
                                     IBuildDefinitionHandle previousBuildDefinitionHandle,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
        Modifies the given subset. The name and build definition are used to locate the previous revision. If the subset has a different name or build definition and a resource already exists with that name and build definition, and error will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        subset - The new version of the subset; must not be null.
        previousName - The name of the subset's previous revision; must not be null.
        previousBuildDefinitionHandle - The build definition associated with the subset's previous revision; must not be null
        monitor - The progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        The time stamp when the subset was successful updated.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
        Since:
        6.0.1

      • saveTransitoryFileList

        java.lang.String saveTransitoryFileList(IBuildableSubset2 subset,
                                      java.lang.String id,
                                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Update the transitory file list with Id as identifier. A transitory file list has a short lifespan and is automatically deleted after a certain number of days has passed. The number of days is configurable in the server's advanced properties. The default value is 7 days.
        Parameters:
        subset - The subset that contains the list of transitory files.
        id - The identifier of the transitory file list.
        monitor - The progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
        Since:
        6.0.1

      • deleteTransitoryFileList

        java.lang.String deleteTransitoryFileList(java.lang.String id,
                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Delete the transitory file list stored with id.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the transitory file list that needs to be deleted.
        monitor - The progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
        Since:
        6.0.1

        Retrieve the transitory files.
        Parameters:

        monitor - The progress monitor; or null if progress is not required.

        Throws:
